definition: see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This eerie festivity is observed in America and Europe on October 31.
sentences.chinese: 美国和欧洲都视10月31日为阴森的节庆。

sentences.english: The attendants at the festival was averaged at about one hundred persons.
sentences.chinese: 参加节庆的人大约有百人之众。

sentences.english: Traffic jam caused by the celebration of the Diwali in North India
sentences.chinese: 北印度排灯节节庆所致的交通堵塞。

sentences.english: This 16-day festival takes place in late September.
sentences.chinese: 这个为期十六天的节庆是于九月下旬开始举行。

sentences.english: Ramadan is a festive time that is anticipated for months by Muslims everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 莱麦丹斋月是各地穆斯林连月盼望的节庆日子。

sentences.english: The blues comes from African songs that people used to sing when they worked and during festivals.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯来源于非洲的劳动号子和节庆歌唱。

sentences.english: That’s where the festival is held.
sentences.chinese: 那里是举行节庆的地方。

sentences.english: Stollen is a holiday favorite that's usually eaten on Christmas Day.
sentences.chinese: 史多伦是一种节庆糕点，通常在圣诞节那天吃。

sentences.english: Wakeboarding festivals and competitions have been held in Singapore and Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡和香港曾举办过尾波滑水节庆和竞赛。

sentences.english: Similar celebrations are observed throughout Asia.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲各地都有类似的节庆。

sentences.english: On festive days, acrobats performed in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 节庆假日，杂耍艺人便在街头卖艺。

sentences.english: On festival days they gather in the plaza to dance to the sound of wooden pipes and drums.
sentences.chinese: 每逢节庆他们欢聚广场，在木笛和木鼓声中起舞。

sentences.english: Summer is the prefect season in witch to stage many types of outdoor festivals.
sentences.chinese: 夏天是筹划各种户外节庆活动的好时节。

definition: the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
folk festival, esp. involving shrine or image of God
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
